node.caption:
Orange White Chocolate UVA Macarons üèÄüç´üçä: The NCAA basketball championship game was last night and the University of Virginia men‚Äôs team, @uvamenshoops, came out on top!! My lil brother went to UVA and was at the final four games in Minneapolis, so I was *kinda* obligated to cheer for them, but damn did they have some close and exciting last few games ü§üüèª‚õπüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Sports games weren‚Äôt really a thing people went to at my alma mater (and when we did have games I was most likely across the street in the engineering lab lol), so it was exciting to cheer for a team that actually is now National Champs! Basketball has always been a big part of my life. My brother and I both played in HS (both pretty tall, but he‚Äôs much better than me), heavily influenced by our dad who still plays and wrecks multiple times a week in his mellow yellow league - So making these were super fun! #wahoowa #gohoos @uva @virginiasports
.
The base macaron recipe from @cloudykitchen & @foxandcrane , adding in 1/2 tsp of orange and 1/2 tsp of vanilla extract.  Filling is a whipped white chocolate ganache, tinted with butterfly pea flowers. @wiltoncakes stars and decorating pen. .
To make ganache, bring 300g of heavy cream to a boil and add a handful of butterfly pea flowers steep for about 10 min. Pour over 16oz of white chocolate, chopped + 2 Tbsp of butter.  Let sit for 3 min then stir until smooth.  Chill in the fridge for 1-2 hours.  Put ganache + 4 Tbsp of butter in bowl of stand mixer with whisk attachment. Whip for at least 5 minutes until light and fluffy.  Add food coloring if you want.
.
.

Lavender Macarons with grapefruit curd buttercream: I originally made these macarons to put on top of my birthday cake (from last post), but the cake became so elaborate that these get their own post! Same color scheme, similar flavors, equally delicious ü§§ .
For the macarons I followed @cloudykitchen & @foxandcrane ‚Äòs tried and true macaron recipe - adding in 1 tsp of @lavenderbythebay ‚Äòs lavender extract along with the vanilla. The filling is Erin‚Äôs vanilla German buttercream plus about 3/4 cup of grapefruit curd added in at the end (recipe for that 2 posts back!). I mixed @wiltoncakes edible dust with vodka to create a glittery paint that I used to paint the shells after they cooled. .
.
.
#lavendermacarons #macarons #frenchmacarons #frenchdesserts #macaronlove #lavender #grapefruitcurd #macaronstagram #bakersofinstagram #flatlaytoday @flatlaytoday #foodstyling #feedfeed @thefeedfeed #huffposttaste @thefeedfeed.baking #f52grams @food52 #tastingtable #foooodieee #infatuation @foodandwine #thebakefeed #bakefromscratch #buzzfeedfood @saveurmag #foodphotography #beautifulcuisines @beautifulcuisines #bakestagram #feedfeedbaking @thrillist  #wsbakeclub #globyfood #foodiefeature #kingarthurflour #bakefromscratch #nycbaker

Dirty Chai Almond Brownies (GF) -  Its currently Passover, and I usually try to keep kosher for passover. That means no wheat, grains or legumes.  A bakers nightmare. My family and I were in Vermont this past weekend and did a small seder in an RV kitchen, which was a sight to be seen üòÇ It was lovely, we skied and hiked! I bought some chai infused honey while there, which inspired these brownies.  I altered a GF Brownie recipe i found on @kingarthurflour , reducing the sugar almost by half since I probably was gonna eat most of these myself, adding some honey, chai spices, espresso and chopped unsweetened @callebautchocolate chocolate (regular chocolate usually has soy lecithin, which isn‚Äôt K for P - according to some). Altered Recipe below! - 5 tbsp butter, melted
- 2/3 cup sugar
- 6 tbsp honey
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1 tsp¬†vanilla
- 1¬†tsp¬†ginger, 1/2¬†tsp¬†cinnamon, 1/2 tsp cardamon, 1/4 tsp allspice, 1/4 tsp cloves
- 1/2 tsp instant espresso, dissolved in 2 tsp hot water
- 3/4 cup¬†cocoa powder
- 3 large eggs
- 1 1/2 cups¬†almond flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 4oz unsweetened chocolate, chopped
- Maldon salt for finishing

Preheat oven to 350.  Mix butter, sugars, salt, vanilla, spices, espresso, cocoa and eggs in a bowl until smooth. Then mix in almond flour and baking powder.  Add in chocolate till just mixed.  Put into a parchment paper lined 8x8 pan.  Bake for 35 min until set. Cool for 15.

#kosherforpassover #brownies  #chocolatebrownies #glutenfree #glutenfreerecipes #glutenfreedesserts #passoverdesserts #kosherfood #almondbrownies #brownieslover  #bakersofinstagram #flatlaytoday @flatlaytoday #foodstyling #feedfeed @thefeedfeed #huffposttaste @thefeedfeed.baking #f52grams @food52 #thebakefeed #bakefromscratch #buzzfeedfood @saveurmag #foodphotography #beautifulcuisines @beautifulcuisines #bakestagram #feedfeedbaking @thrillist  #wsbakeclub #foodiefeature #kingarthurflour #bakefromscratch #nycbaker #gloobyfood

Chocolate Grapefruit Lavender Birthday Cake: Today is my birthday so I decided to be extra extra and spend most of the day baking and constructing this elaborate cake üéâüéÇ Baking is my happy place and being able to share this later with friends will be the best present I can wish for.  This cake has some of my favorite flavors.  Chocolate cake from @testkitchen , filled with whipped dark chocolate ganache and blood orange buttercream, and covered with a grapefruit curd German buttercream (recipe in last post!). Super fun to make and I‚Äôm excited to taste it soon!
.
.
.

Strawberry Balsamic Pie: Its Pi Day ü•ß, one of the best internet/real life holidays around! It combines two or my passions perfectly, baking (pie) and engineering/math (pi)
.
I remember celebrating the holiday in High School with the Mu Alpha THeta (math) club (yes i was so cool) - we made t-shirts with all the numbers of Pi and just ate a ton of dessert. Fast forward 10 years, and I‚Äôm still that nerd wearing a blouse with numbers all over it (at least its designer now :P), working in tech as an software eng, bringing in pie for coworkers. Some things never change. .
Pie recipe from The Four & Twenty Blackbirds Pie Book @birdsblack ! After forming the dough and splitting it, i kneaded in some beet powder to achieve the pinkish dough.  @lokokitchen is lattice inspiration/goals always . Ill post the baked version soon! The color baked out a bit but still looks üíØ
.
.
.

Cardamom Vanilla Halva: As someone of you may know from my stories, I bought a large quality of @soomfoods tahini last year and have been slowly working my way though it / giving it out to friends and family.  I recently opened up the ‚Äúbucket‚Äù to  fill up some jars and thought it was time to try and make halva. .
Halva is a traditional middle eastern / Israeli candy thats basically made of tahini and sugar and has a crumbly texture.  Its one of my favorite sweets and I can‚Äôt believe I had never made it! There are a few companies in NYC that make great flavored halva but its pretty expensive per pound.  This recipe literally took me 20 minutes to make and produced probably about 1.5lbs. Great use of tahini if you‚Äôve had a jar sitting in the back of your cabinet for a while!
.
I used the salted chocolate halva recipe from @bonappetitmag as the starting off point
- 1 ¬Ω cups tahini
- ¬º tsp. kosher salt
- 4 Tbsp. black and white sesame seeds, mixed
- 1 ¬Ω cups sugar
- 1 tsp cardamom
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- flaky sea salt
Line a 8x8 pan with parchment.  Mix tahini, salt, 1/2 of the sesame seeds, cardamom in a medium bowl.  In a small saucepan with a candy thermometer over low heat, cook sugar, vanilla + 1/2 cup water until sugar is dissolved.  Increase to medium-high and cook, without stirring it. Once the thermometer reads 250Àö, slowly pour the sugar syrup into the tahini mix, mixing constantly until it starts to pull away from the bowl.  Scrape into the pan, sprinkle the remaining seeds + flaky sea salt and let completely cool.  Cut and enjoy!
.
.
#halva #israelifood #israeligram #homemadecandy #tahini #candy #tahinirecipes @flatlaytoday #foodstyling #feedfeed @thefeedfeed #huffposttaste @thefeedfeed.baking #f52grams @food52 #thebakefeed #bakefromscratch #buzzfeedfood @saveurmag #foodphotography #beautifulcuisines @beautifulcuisines #bakestagram #feedfeedbaking @thrillist  #wsbakeclub #foodtographyschool #foodiefeature #kingarthurflour #bakefromscratch #nycbaker #gloobyfood #spoonfed

Halva Jam Hamentashen: PSA - Purim is tomorrow! I‚Äôve been wanting to make these forever! I am a huge fan of halva/tahini (hence my purchase of @tahinibucket) and these are heavenly! The halva spread is basically tahini, honey, (I used some date syrup too!), cinnamon and vanilla and is really freakin addicting. Hamentashen is a traditional shortbread cookie filled with jam or chocolate that‚Äôs triangle shaped to represent Haman‚Äôs hat, one of the bad guys in the Purim story. .
.
Recipe is by @mollyyeh and i pretty much followed it to a T! Used four berry jam by @bonnemaman_us . I added an egg wash to make them a bit more shiny
.
.
#hamentashen #jamhamentashen #halva #purim #purim2019 #jewishbaking #jewishfood #cookies @flatlaytoday #foodstyling #feedfeed @thefeedfeed #huffposttaste @thefeedfeed.baking #f52grams @food52 #thebakefeed #bakefromscratch #buzzfeedfood @saveurmag #foodphotography #beautifulcuisines @beautifulcuisines #bakestagram #feedfeedbaking @thrillist  #wsbakeclub #foodtographyschool #foodiefeature #kingarthurflour #bakefromscratch #nycbaker #globyfood #spoonfeed

Strawberry Balsamic Pie: I just wanted to share the baked version of the pie I made for Pi(e) Day a few weeks ago! It‚Äôs a strawberry balsamic pie with beet root colored dough, painstakingly woven while watching too much tv.
.
Pie recipe is from The Four & Twenty Blackbirds Pie Book @birdsblack! Lattice inspired by @lokokitchen .
.

Blood Orange & Almond Olive Oil Cake with Grapefruit Curd, Blackberries and Ricotta: Happy Friday! While winter may not be the best time for produce, at least we have those citrus trees down south to brighten things up!  I grew up in South Florida and my family used to have a grapefruit tree in the backyard.  I never was a huge fan of grapefruit when we had that tree (it got chopped down because of some state-wide citrus disease ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è), but it really has grown on me in the past few years.  This vanilla grapefruit curd may be my favorite curd I‚Äôve ever made.  I‚Äôve literally been eating spoonfuls of it by itself, with greek yogurt, on pretzels, you name it üôÑ
.
Recipe adapted from @chef.souschef Almond Lemon Curd Cake recipe! Subbed blood orange juice + zest in the cake and used my own grapefruit curd recipe below. Assembled with regular ricotta cheese, blackberries!
.
Grapefruit Curd:
2/3 cup sugar
2 tbsp grapefruit zest
1/2 tsp vanilla powder or extract
3 eggs
4 egg yolks
3/4 cup of grapefruit juice (~3 grapefruits)
4 tbsp butter, cold and cubed
Mash the sugar, zest and vanilla together either with a fork or mortar/pestle. Heat an inch of water to a simmer in a medium pot and put a heat proof glass bowl on top. Combine the sugar, and all the eggs and whisk til the sugar is dissolved.  Add the grapefruit juice and cook, whisking often until it reads about 170F and the thickness of pudding. Remove from heat and whisk in butter until it‚Äôs all incorporated. Pour through a mesh strainer into a jar and chill for at least 2 hours before using.
.
.
#grapefruitcurd #bloodorange #grapefruit #cake #oliveoilcake #almondcake #layercake #foodstyling #feedfeed @thefeedfeed #huffposttaste @thefeedfeed.baking #f52grams @food52 #forkyeah #tastingtable #foooodieee #infatuation #foodandwine @foodandwine #thebakefeed #bakefromscratch #buzzfeedfood @saveurmag #foodphotography #beautifulcuisines @beautifulcuisines #bakestagram #feedfeedbaking @thrillist  #wsbakeclub #foodtographyschool #foodiefeatur #insiderdesser #kingarthurflour #bakefromscratch

Healthy-ish Strawberry Zucchini?! Poptarts: (+Recipe) What‚Äôs a better way to start your lazy Sunday with these healthy-ish pop tarts?! I say -ish because that sugar glaze is definitely not helping my case, but there‚Äôs zucchini inside! Thats healthy! And chia seeds! üòÇ I had strawberries and zucchini in my fridge and thought can I jam it? Yes I can apparently. And its super good. I have been eating the left over jam for days on crackers and in my yogurt.  Jam fruit to sugar usually are 2:1.  However, the chia seeds expand to give it a jammy texture, which allows for very little sugar be added and it still keeps that consistency. Let me know if you try making the jam or pop tart! Recipe below!
.
.
Strawberry Zucchini Chia Jam
- 1 lb strawberries, diced
- 1 cup shredded zucchini (about 1 zucchini)
- 1/2 cup (3.5oz) sugar
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1/4 cup chia seeds
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
Dough - 1 pie dough recipe -  I used the recipe from @birdsblack which is GREAT, but any pie crust recipe, homemade or not works!
Glaze
- 1¬†cup¬†powdered sugar
- 4¬†Tbsp¬†heavy cream
- 1/2¬†tsp¬†vanilla extract
- Sprinkles
.
Makes 15
Jam - Add strawberries and zucchini in a medium saucepan and cook on medium heat until they start to break down a bit, 5-6 min. Add sugar, lemon juice and salt. Cook for another 5 min, making sure you stir the pot frequently to prevent burning and that the jam dissolves.  Add the chia seeds and cook for an additional 10 minutes, or until its at a jam like consistently.  The chia seeds should get plump.  Pour into a jar and let cool completely.
Poptarts - Roll out the prepared chilled dough and cut 2.5x3in rectangles. Fill with a tablespoon or so of jam and pinch the edges, crimping with a fork.  Bake at 375 for 20-25 min or until golden.  Mix glaze ingredients and drizzle over pop tarts once cooled.  Add sprinkles
.
.
#homemadepoptarts #strawberrypoptarts #healthyish #healthyrecipes #homemade #poptarts #healthy #breakfast #zucc#handpies #piecrust @flatlaytoday #foodstyling #feedfeed @thefeedfeed #huffposttaste @thefeedfeed.baking #f52grams @food52 #thebakefeed #bakefromscratch #nycbaker #globyfood #gloobyfood #spoonfed #imsomartha #bakestagram #wsbakeclub

Blood Orange Key Lime Pie: It is officially pie week! (Recipe below) I spent the past weekend in the Florida panhandle with my parents soaking up the sun, riding bikes and playing with the family cats. I had some leftover blood oranges I wanted to use and since key lime pie is such a Florida staple, we combined the two! (Whenever I‚Äôm home, baking is a combined effort with my mom and I - she taught me *most* of what I know üòú) This is her recipe and it‚Äôs suuuuper easy with very little ingredients! .
Crust:
1c plus 2 ¬Ω tbsp graham cracker crumbs
5tbsp butter
1/3c sugar ..
Filling:
3 egg yolks
1 14oz can sweetened condensed milk
1/3c key lime juice
1/3c blood orange juice ...
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. ¬†Butter a 9‚Äù pie pan. ¬†Stir together crumbs, butter and sugar until combined well. ¬†Press the mixture into the bottom and sides of the pan. ¬†Bake crust until set and golden, about 8 minutes. ¬†Let cool on a wire rack. .... In an electric mixer with a whisk attachment, beat the egg yolks at a high speed until very fluffy, about 5 minutes. ¬†Gradually add condensed milk and continue to beat until thick, about 3-4 minutes longer. ¬†Lower the mixer speed and slowly add the lime and orange juice, mixing just until combined. ¬†Pour into the crust. ¬†Bake 10 minutes or until just set. ¬†Cool on a wire rack, then refrigerate. ¬†Freeze for 15-20 minutes before serving.
.....

Rye and Tahini Chocolate Chip Cookies: Just a little fresh outta the oven cookie porn for ya this Thursday!  Its almost the end of the week and the weather in NYC is finally starting to feel like spring, which means it time to celebrate.  Currently my favorite cookie recipe is this Rye and Tahini CCC from @boywhobakes. I am slightly impartial to anything with tahini and sesame seeds in it, but I‚Äôm telling you these are dope! The rye adds great depth and the seeds give a nice crunch while still being soft inside ü§§ I may have eaten like 4 in a row as soon as these came out of the oven #livingmybestlife .
.
#chocolatechipcookies #chocolatechipcookie #cookies #chocolatecookies #tahinicookies  #tahini #cookielove #flatlay @flatlaytoday #foodstyling #feedfeed @thefeedfeed #huffposttaste @thefeedfeed.baking #f52grams @food52 #thebakefeed #bakefromscratch #buzzfeedfood @saveurmag #foodphotography #beautifulcuisines @beautifulcuisines #bakestagram #feedfeedbaking @thrillist  #wsbakeclub #foodtographyschool #foodiefeature #kingarthurflour #bakefromscratch #nycbaker #gloobyfood #spoonfed #heresmyfood #rslove

markdownRemark.excerpt: The first month of the New Year has already flown by and it‚Äôs bitter cold here in Brooklyn.  Even though winter is always fun (ie. skiing), I get that yearning‚Ä¶
markdownRemark.html:
The first month of the New Year has already flown by and it‚Äôs bitter cold here in Brooklyn. Even though winter is always fun (ie. skiing), I get that yearning to be on a beach in Mexico or basking in the Mediterranean sun whenever I am trudging to work through the snowy dirty streets of New York. Making and eating this Mexican Ricotta Cheesecake with a Tomato Mole Jam is possibly the next best thing to hopping on a flight to warmer weather. It has loads of spicy, complex flavors that will keep you warm and preoccupied until the sun comes out in a few months.

When i was approached by Muir Glen and The Feedfeed to develop a recipe for them using their organic canned tomatoes, I wanted to think outside the box. Wanting to stay true to my mostly dessert feed, a tomato jam immediately came to mind. Tomato jams are usually made with onions, cumin and other savory spices. They show up on cheese plates, as condiments for sandwiches, on top of eggs and in vinaigrettes. I wanted to make a more complex, sweeter jam that could do double duty as a perfect addition to a cheese plate but not feel weird on top of a dessert. Mole is a traditional sauce used in Mexican cuisines. According to Wikipedia - the source of all knowledge - a mole sauce contains a fruit, chili pepper, nut, and such spices as black pepper, cinnamon, cumin, and chocolate. I could work with that. As you can see in the final recipe below, my mole jam has a lot of that - cinnamon, dried fruit, almonds and cocoa. The results? A sweet, (but not too sweet!) dynamic, interesting jam with a slightly spicy aftertaste. It tastes like a tomato jam, but it also doesn‚Äôt really taste a whole lot like what you would think tomatoes taste like. But what do I put it on?

Enter the ricotta cheesecake. Using ricotta in place of some of the cream cheese makes the cake a lot lighter (in a calorie and fluffier way). This creates a good balance with the graham cracker crust and thick dense mole jam. By using the tried and true water bath method (outlined in the instructions), my cheesecake came out perfect with no cracks, no overcooked edges and a flat top! I also left it in the oven after I turned off the heat for a few hours, which I‚Äôve read helps prevent cracking.

I ventured to my local co-op to buy the tomatoes, spices and other ingredients for this recipe. Flatbush Food Coop is the closest one to me, but you can find your closest one here! The tomatoes are currently on sale for 10/$10 - which is very exciting because that‚Äôs almost half their regular price. Speaking of deals (which I‚Äôm a huge fan of), the entire co-op was extremely reasonably priced and they had an extensive bulk food and spice section where you can get just what you need (like for this recipe!).

This cake is perfect when you want to try making something different. The jam itself is a showstopper and I can imagine it works very well with all sorts of cheese, on top of your morning bagel and cream cheese, inside a pastry or mixed into yogurt. The jam makes a little more than you actually need to cover the cake, so let me know if you make this recipe and what you did with the extra!

This post is sponsored by Muir Glen and The Feedfeed, but all opinions are my own.
